title: PowerShell Basics: Part 1
description: Learn the basics of PowerShell including commands, variables, and pipelines.
content:
# PowerShell Basics: Part 1

## Introduction
PowerShell is a powerful scripting language and shell developed by Microsoft. It's designed for system administration and automation.

## Basic Commands

### Get-Command
Lists all available commands:
```powershell
Get-Command
```

### Get-Help
Provides help information for commands:
```powershell
Get-Help Get-Process
```

## Variables
Variables in PowerShell start with a $ symbol:
```powershell
$name = 'World'
Write-Host "Hello, $name!"
```

## Pipelines
PowerShell uses pipelines (|) to pass output from one command to another:
```powershell
Get-Process | Sort-Object CPU -Descending | Select-Object -First 5
```

## Try It Yourself
1. Create a variable with your name
2. Print a greeting using that variable
3. List the top 3 processes using the most memory on your system
